[[The Shire]] | affiliation= | language= | birth= | birthlocation= | rule= | death= | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor=Founding the [[Shire]] | family= | parentage= | siblings= | spouse= | children= | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Marcho''' and '''Blanco''' were brothers, [[Bree-hobbits]] of [[Fallohides|Fallohide]] stock who founded [[the Shire]] in [[Third Age 1601]].{{FR|Hobbits}}, p. 4{{App|Baggins}}, p. 1099 ==History== In {{TA|1601}}, the two brothers led a group of mostly [[Harfoots|Harfoot]] [[hobbits]] westwards from [[Bree]]. They crossed the river [[Baranduin]] at the [[Brandywine Bridge|Bridge of Stonebows]], and with the permission of [[King of Arthedain|King]] [[Argeleb II]] they settled in the royal hunting grounds of [[Arthedain]] and founded [[the Shire]]. Soon after (c. {{TA|1630}}) they are joined by [[Stoors]], who come up from [[Dunland]] and settle in the Shire.{{App|TA}}, p. 1086 ==Etymology== Marcho contains the [[Old English]] element ''*marh'' ("horse") and Blanco is derived from Old English ''blanca'' ("white horse", "grey horse").[[Tom Shippey]], [[The Road to Middle-earth]], Chapter 4 A Cartographic Plot, '''''Maps and Names''''', p. 116{{HM|IE}}, "An etymological excursion among the Shire Folk", p. 181 ==Inspiration== The two brothers are perhaps based on [[Wikipedia:Hengest|Hengest]] and [[Wikipedia:Horsa|Horsa]], who brought the Angles, Saxons and Jutes to England. It is noteworthy that both ''hengest''{{webcite|website=[http://www.bosworthtoller.com/ Bosworth-Toller Anglo-Saxon Dictionary]|articleurl=https://bosworthtoller.com/18697|articlename=hengest|accessed=18 April 2025}} and ''horsa'' mean "stallion" and "horse", respectively, in [[Old English]]. ==Other versions of the legendarium== In an earlier typescript version of the Prologue{{PM|Prologue}}, typescript P 2 footnote relating to "about the year 1050 in Shire-reckoning" and in an earlier manuscript version of the family tree of the Baggins family{{PM|Trees}}, manuscript BA 3 the two Hobbit brothers whe founded the Shire were called Marco and Cavallo. ==Portrayal in adaptations== ===Marcho and Blanco in adaptations=== Mithril Miniatures - Marcho and Blanco.jpg|[[Mithril Miniatures]] Mithril Miniatures - Marcho and Blanco 2.jpg|[[Mithril Miniatures]] {{References}} [[Category:Hobbits]] [[Category:Fallohides]] [[Category:Third Age characters]] [[de:Marcho]] [[fi:Marcho]] [[fr:encyclo/personnages/hobbits/marcho]] __NOTOC__
